name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸 n. (Debris)人名；(法)德布里

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: evacuating
trans: v. 疏散；撤出；排泄（evacuate的ing形式） adj. 疏散的；排出的；排气的

name: hijack
trans: vt. 抢劫；揩油 vi. 拦路抢劫 n. 劫持；威逼；敲诈

sentences.english: The airliner was hijacked by a group of terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 该航班被一帮恐怖分子劫持。

detailed_translations.english: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship
when a plane, vehicle etc is hijacked

name: memorial
trans: n. 纪念碑，纪念馆；纪念仪式；纪念物 adj. 记忆的；纪念的，追悼的

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉 vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售 vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: terrorist
trans: n. 恐怖主义者，恐怖分子 adj. 恐怖主义者的，恐怖分子的

sentences.english: We refuse to talk to terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

sentences.english: a terrorist bomb that left 168 people dead
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands

name: accomplice
trans: n. 同谋者，[法] 共犯

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: destitute
trans: adj. 穷困的；无的；缺乏的 n. 赤贫者 vt. 使穷困；夺去

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute .
sentences.chinese: 这场洪水使许多人变得一无所有。

detailed_translations.english: having no money, no food, no home etc

name: hospitality
trans: n. 好客；殷勤

sentences.english: Thanks for your hospitality over the past few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你几周来的热情款待。

detailed_translations.english: friendly behaviour towards visitors

name: loot
trans: n. 战利品；抢劫；掠夺品 vt. 抢劫，洗劫；强夺 vi. 洗劫，掠夺；抢劫

sentences.english: Shops were looted and burned.
sentences.chinese: 商店遭到抢劫和焚毁。

detailed_translations.english: goods taken by soldiers from a place where they have won a battle
to steal things, especially from shops or homes that have been damaged in a war or  riot

name: plunder
trans: v. 掠夺，抢劫；侵吞，剽窃；将……滥用殆尽 n. 抢夺；战利品；掠夺品

sentences.english: Henry’s army returned loaded down with plunder.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的部队满载战利品而归。

detailed_translations.english: things that have been stolen during a violent attack, especially during a war
to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war

name: prosperous
trans: adj. 繁荣的；兴旺的

sentences.english: a prosperous landowner
sentences.chinese: 富裕的土地拥有者

detailed_translations.english: rich and successful

name: curiosity
trans: n. 好奇，好奇心；珍品，古董，古玩

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

name: notion
trans: n. 概念；见解；打算

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: offended
trans: adj. 不舒服，生气 v. 冒犯（offend的过去分词）

name: shrink
trans: v. （使）缩小，（使）收缩；（尤指因恐惧而）退缩，畏缩，回避；（衣服、布料）缩水 n. 收缩；畏缩；（非正式）精神病医生，精神病学家，心理学家

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: tumble
trans: vi. 摔倒；倒塌；滚动；打滚；仓惶地行动 vt. 使摔倒；使滚翻；弄乱 n. 跌倒；翻筋斗；跌跤 [ 过去式tumbled 过去分词tumbled 现在分词tumbling ]

sentences.english: Oil prices have tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 石油价格猛跌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌倒，摔下，滚下；翻滚；暴跌；不由自主地卷入
detailed_translations.english: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement
a fall, especially from a high place or level

name: fit
trans: vt. 安装；使……适应；使……合身；与……相符 vi. 符合，配合；适合；合身 adj. 健康的；合适的；恰当的；准备好的 n. 合身；发作；痉挛 n. (Fit)人名；(捷、罗)菲特

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: flurry
trans: n. 慌张；疾风；飓风；骚动；一阵忙乱（或激动、兴奋等）；小阵雪（或雨等）；（尤指衣服）窸窣；（同时出现的）一系列事物；一阵混乱 v. 使恐慌；使激动；慌张；激动；（雪或树叶）微飘；（人）快速行动

name: pun
trans: n. 双关语，俏皮话 v. 说双关语，说俏皮话；把（泥土，碎石等）击打成团 n. (Pun) （美、港）汶（人名）

sentences.english: I could be cynical and say he probably did it hoping to make a killing -- pardon the pun -- but for the sake of the higher argument I'll play along.
sentences.chinese: 我也许可以玩世不恭的说他这么做是希望开发出一个在市场上“必杀”的游戏——请原谅我的双关语——但为了更高层的论题，我权且同意他的话。

detailed_translations.english: to make a pun
an amusing use of a word or phrase that has two meanings, or of words that have the same sound but different meanings

name: signify
trans: vt. 表示；意味；预示 vi. 有重要性；要紧；冒充内行

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: upset
trans: vt. 使心烦；颠覆；扰乱 vi. 翻倒 adj. 心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的 n. 混乱；翻倒；颠覆

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: verdict
trans: n. 结论；裁定

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: absurd
trans: adj. 荒谬的；可笑的 n. 荒诞；荒诞作品

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: adjourn
trans: vi. 休会；延期；换地方 vt. 推迟；使…中止；使…延期

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

name: consultation
trans: n. 咨询；磋商；[临床] 会诊；讨论会

sentences.english: They retired to another room for private consultation.
sentences.chinese: 他们退到另一房间秘密磋商。

sentences.english: This is a critical question that we must answer together through consultation and coordination.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个我们必须通过磋商和协调共同回答的关键问题。

detailed_translations.english: a discussion in which people who are affected by or involved in something can give their opinions

name: fancy
trans: v. 想做；喜爱；自负；想象；设想，认为；（尤指速度竞赛）认为……要赢；（表示惊讶或反对） 真没想到 n. 幻想；想象力；爱好； （赛马等体育比赛中）最被看好的人或动物；（拳击等运动的）爱好者；花式蛋糕或饼干；（16和17世纪音乐用语）幻想曲 adj. 复杂的；昂贵的；精致的，花俏的；想象的；（食物）优质的；（花）杂色的；（动物）供观赏的 n. (Fancy) 范茜（人名）

sentences.english: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
to like or want something, or want to do something

name: message
trans: n. 消息；差使；启示；预言；广告词 vi. 报信，报告；[通信] 报文 vt. 通知

sentences.english: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.english: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。

sentences.english: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across (= communicate what you want to say ) without being so angry.
sentences.chinese: 就算不这么生气，你也完全可以把意思说清楚。

sentences.english: They use illustrations to convey their message.
sentences.chinese: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

detailed_translations.english: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc

name: alter
trans: vt. 改变，更改 vi. 改变；修改 n. (Alter) （美、德）阿尔特（人名）

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触 vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: languid
trans: adj. 倦怠的；呆滞的；无精打采的；（人举止、姿势）无力的；（因疾病、劳累）虚弱的；（场合、时段）闲适安逸的；不活跃的；懒洋洋的；慢悠悠的，慵懒的

sentences.english: He greeted Charles with a languid wave of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他无精打采地挥挥手，算是和查尔斯打招呼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倦怠的；呆滞的；软弱无力的

name: serpent
trans: n. 蛇（尤指大蛇或毒蛇）；狡猾的人

sentences.english: ...the serpent in the Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: …伊甸园里的那条蛇。

detailed_translations.english: a snake, especially a large one

name: Cheshire
trans: n. 柴郡（英国一郡名）

name: croquet
trans: n. 槌球戏；循环球戏 vi. 打自己的球以击走对方的球 n. (Croquet)人名；(法)克罗凯

name: giddy
trans: adj. 头晕的；眼花的；令人眼花缭乱的；轻浮的 vt. 使晕眩；使眼花缭乱 vi. 眼花；眩晕 n. (Giddy)人名；(英)吉迪

sentences.english: Greg stared down from the seventh floor and began to feel giddy .
sentences.chinese: 格雷格从七楼望下去，开始觉得头晕了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 头晕的；眼花的；令人眼花缭乱的；轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: feeling slightly sick and unable to balance, because everything seems to be moving

name: mad
trans: adj. 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的 n. 狂怒

sentences.english: He can’t possibly get that finished in time. He must be mad !
sentences.chinese: 他不可能按时完成的。他一定是疯了！

sentences.english: I’d go mad (= start to feel crazy ) if I was stuck at home all day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我整天困在家里我会发疯的。

sentences.english: He’s been driving me mad !
sentences.chinese: 他真让我受不了！

sentences.english: You’ve agreed to marry him! Are you mad?
sentences.chinese: 你已经同意跟他结婚了！你疯了吗？

sentences.english: Surely no one would be mad enough to fly in this weather?
sentences.chinese: 肯定没有人会傻到在这样的天气条件下飞行吧？

sentences.english: My friends all think I’m stark raving mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友都认为我是彻底疯了。

sentences.english: It’s enough to send you barking mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 这足以让你发狂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的
detailed_translations.english: crazy or very silly

name: uncivil
trans: adj. 不文明的；粗野的；失礼的

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的 n. (Civil)人名；(土)吉维尔；(法)西维尔

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: dormouse
trans: n. 榛睡鼠

name: proposal
trans: n. 提议，建议；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: quarrel
trans: n. 吵架，口角；反目，失和；争吵（或抱怨）的原因；方头凿，方头投掷物；方镞箭 v. 吵架，争论；反对；挑剔；抱怨

sentences.english: I wish you two would stop quarreling.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

sentences.english: Jacob left after a quarrel with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布和妻子吵了一架后走了。

detailed_translations.english: to have an argument
an angry argument or disagreement

name: treacle
trans: n. 糖蜜；过分甜蜜的声调

name: behead
trans: vt. 砍头；使河流被夺流

name: courtier
trans: n. 朝臣；奉承者；谄媚者 n. (Courtier)人名；(法)库尔捷

name: dispute
trans: n. 辩论；争吵；意见不同 v. 辩论；对……进行质疑；争夺；抵抗（进攻）

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的 vt. 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: impertinent
trans: adj. 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的

sentences.english: He was always asking impertinent questions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是问一些唐突的问题。

sentences.english: You are an impertinent young woman.
sentences.chinese: 你这姑娘真没礼貌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not respectful, especially to someone who is older or more important

name: provoking
trans: adj. 刺激的；令人生气的；激怒人的 v. 刺激；激怒；挑拨；诱发；鼓动（provoke 的现在分词）

name: classic

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意

sentences.chinese: 他恳求老师原谅他。

sentences.chinese: 我恳切地请求你原谅。

trans: n. 脾气；（钢等）回火；性情；倾向 vt. 使回火；锻炼；调和；使缓和 vi. 回火；调和

sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

sentences.chinese: 在神经元之间，在一个神经元的轴突，和另一个神经元的树突之间，有一个细小的缝隙。

sentences.chinese: 但是他们不十分准确的了解存储记忆的时候是什么被带进了神经元，如果你想要忘记某些事情，有如何让连接的触突解散。

sentences.chinese: 这样的经历一开始让我觉得有点怪，不过现在却非常熟稔，这对我的摄影历险非常适合，类似于刚进入暗房时人的眼睛和视角要先适应一下。

sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

sentences.chinese: 不要为他的话而生气，他并没有冒犯谁的意思。

sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立

sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.

sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: a left-wing militia group
sentences.chinese: 左翼民兵团体

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

name: poverty

sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

name: immigrant

sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East

name: persecution

sentences.chinese: …对少数派的迫害。

sentences.english: ...victims of political persecution.
sentences.chinese: …政治迫害的受害者。

sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

trans: vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: booty
trans: n. 战利品；赃物；获得之物 n. (Booty)人名；(英)布蒂

name: devious
trans: adj. 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的

sentences.english: a devious route
sentences.chinese: 迂回的路线

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的
detailed_translations.english: not going in the most direct way to get to a place

name: eerie
trans: adj. 可怕的；怪异的

sentences.english: the eerie sound of an owl hooting at night
sentences.chinese: 夜间猫头鹰那怪异恐怖的叫声

detailed_translations.english: strange and frightening

name: entranced
trans: adj. 着迷的；狂喜的

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: bazaar
trans: n. 集市；市场；义卖市场

sentences.english: Kamal was a vendor in Cairo's open-air bazaar.
sentences.chinese: 卡莫尔曾是开罗露天集市的摊贩。

detailed_translations.english: a market or area where there are a lot of small shops, especially in India or the Middle East

name: monsoon
trans: n. 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风

sentences.english: ...the end of the monsoon.
sentences.chinese: …雨季的结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风
detailed_translations.english: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

name: Muslim
trans: n. 穆斯林；穆罕默德信徒 adj. 伊斯兰教的

sentences.english: ...Iran and other Muslim countries.
sentences.chinese: …伊朗和其他穆斯林国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 穆斯林（的）；伊斯兰教信徒（的）
detailed_translations.english: someone whose religion is Islam

name: peninsula
trans: n. 半岛

sentences.english: the Korean peninsula
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜半岛

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but joined to a large area of land

name: sediment
trans: n. 沉积；沉淀物

sentences.english: a thick layer of sediment
sentences.chinese: 一层厚厚的沉积物

detailed_translations.english: solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid

name: advocate
trans: v. 提倡，拥护；为……辩护 n. 拥护者；辩护者；辩护律师，出庭律师；律师；为（某团体）谋利益者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: eloquent
trans: adj. 意味深长的；雄辩的，有口才的；有说服力的；动人的

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: glacier
trans: n. 冰河，冰川

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: naturalist
trans: n. 自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人 adj. 自然的（等于naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: I am sometimes described as a naturalist.
sentences.chinese: 有时我也被称作自然主义者。

sentences.english: An American naturalist wrote:"a patriot must always be ready to defend his country against its government".
sentences.chinese: 一位美国自然主义者写道：“爱国者要随时准备好为了保卫国家而与政府斗争！”

sentences.english: To illustrate this, let me refer to the naturalist science of the 19th century, and the effects it had on our opinions of life.
sentences.chinese: 为了诠释这点，我要引用下19世纪的自然主义科学及其它对我们的生活观念所产生的影响。

name: immune
trans: adj. 免疫的；免于……的，免除的 n. 免疫者；免除者

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: paralyze
trans: vt. 使麻痹；使瘫痪

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

name: polio
trans: n. 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎

sentences.english: Gladys was crippled by polio at the age of 3.
sentences.chinese: 格拉迪丝3岁时因小儿麻痹症而瘸了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎
detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease of the nerves in the  spine  , that often results in someone being permanently unable to move particular muscles

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗；牛痘苗 adj. 疫苗的；牛痘的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: ally
trans: n. 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手 vt. 使联盟；使联合 vi. 联合；结盟 n. (Ally)人名；(巴基)阿利；(法)阿利；(英)艾丽(女子教名 Alice 的简称)；(尼日利)阿利

sentences.english: a meeting of the European allies
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.english: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手
detailed_translations.english: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

name: assassinate
trans: vt. 暗杀；行刺

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: dictator
trans: n. 独裁者；命令者

sentences.english: the downfall of the hated dictator
sentences.chinese: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

name: martyr
trans: n. 烈士，殉道者；乞怜者；因疾病或困难长期受折磨者；假圣人 v. 殉难；折磨；杀害 n. (Martyr) 马特（人名）

sentences.english: St. Stephen, the first Christian martyr
sentences.chinese: 圣司提反，第一个基督教殉道者

sentences.english: The army has been held back because the government is reluctant to make martyrs of the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 军队后撤了，因为政府不愿意造成抗议者牺牲。

sentences.english: St. Pancras was martyred in 304 A.D.
sentences.chinese: 圣·潘克瑞斯在公元304年蒙难。

detailed_translations.english: someone who dies for their religious or political beliefs and is admired by people for this
If someone is martyred, they are killed or made to suffer greatly because of their religious or political beliefs

name: orator
trans: n. 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告

sentences.english: He was a natural politician, a gifted orator who knew how to work a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是位天生的政治家，是位有天赋且知道如何凝集民众的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

name: equator
trans: n. 赤道

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: sanctuary
trans: n. 避难所；至圣所；耶路撒冷的神殿

sentences.english: His church became a sanctuary for thousands of people who fled the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他的教堂成了数千逃避内战的人们的一个避难所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避难所；至圣所；耶路撒冷的神殿
detailed_translations.english: a peaceful place that is safe and provides protection, especially for people who are in danger

name: savanna
trans: n. [生态] 热带草原；热带的稀树大草原

name: hardship
trans: n. 困苦；苦难；艰难险阻

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

name: homestead
trans: n. 宅地；家园；田产

sentences.english: He had seen the tribulation of the homestead and mankind from his own tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 海子从自身苦难体验出发目睹了家园和人类苦难。

sentences.english: Heavy clouds hang low over a dilapidated homestead in the Midwest, foretelling a possible tornado.
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的云层低低地悬在中西部残破的宅地上空，预示可能发生龙卷风。

sentences.english: The Xanadu complex is mutual to Shen Congwen and readers, is human's pursuit and expectation to ideal homestead.
sentences.chinese: “桃源”情结是沈从文和读者共有的，是人类对理想家园的追寻和期待。

detailed_translations.english: In United States history, a homestead was a piece of government land in the west, which was given to someone so they could settle there and develop a farm

name: income
trans: n. 收入，收益；所得

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: pioneer
trans: n. 先锋；拓荒者 vt. 开辟；倡导；提倡 vi. 作先驱

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: prairie
trans: n. 大草原；牧场

sentences.english: About 160 species of rare birds live in the swamps and prairie there.
sentences.chinese: 大约有160种珍稀鸟类栖息在这里的沼泽地和大草原上。

sentences.english: How many an afternoon antinia and i have trailed along the prairie under the magnificence .
sentences.chinese: 有多少个下午，我同安东妮亚在大草原上这种壮丽的景色中慢慢地走着啊！

sentences.english: From your English garden variety to your prairie wildflower, floral prints tell a sweet story.
sentences.chinese: 从英式花园的百花齐放到大草原的野花儿，印花叙述着甜美的故事。

detailed_translations.english: a wide open area of fairly flat land in North America which is covered in grass or wheat

name: publisher
trans: n. 出版者，出版商；发行人

sentences.english: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.
sentences.chinese: 出版社计划将这份杂志做成周刊。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers etc

name: gloss
trans: n. 光彩；用以产生光泽的物质；光泽涂料；假象；注释 v. 注释；（古）曲解；掩盖；使光彩 n. (Gloss) （美、俄、英）格洛斯（人名）

sentences.english: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
sentences.chinese: 用了这种发胶，即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

detailed_translations.english: a bright shine on a surface

name: lament
trans: n. 挽歌；恸哭；悲痛之情 vi. 哀悼；悲叹；悔恨 vt. 哀悼；痛惜 n. (Lament)人名；(葡)拉门特；(法)拉芒

sentences.english: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
sentences.chinese: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

detailed_translations.english: to express feelings of great sadness about something
a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness

name: quirk
trans: n. 怪癖；急转；借口 n. (Quirk)人名；(英)夸克

sentences.english: Like every computer, this one has its little quirks.
sentences.chinese: 就像所有电脑一样，这台也有它的小毛病。

detailed_translations.english: a strange habit or feature of someone’s character, or a strange feature of something

name: reprieve
trans: v. 取消（或缓期）执行……的死刑；取消关闭，暂缓终止 n. 缓刑，赦免；暂缓，暂时解救

sentences.english: As for my unlikely allies, I think that I shall allow them a reprieve.
sentences.chinese: 至于我的盟友们，我想我应该给他们一个缓刑的机会。

sentences.english: You will be converted—you will be converted just as soon as every effort to compass pardon, commutation, or reprieve HAS failed—and then!
sentences.chinese: 您会痛悔前非——就在人们为您恳求赦免、申请减刑、或改判缓刑的一切努力统告失败的时候，您会痛悔前非的。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop a prisoner from being killed as a punishment
a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen

name: stupefied
trans: adj. 目瞪口呆的；呆若木鸡的 v. 吓呆（stupefy的过去分词）

name: apprentice
trans: n. 学徒；生手 vt. 使…当学徒 vi. 当学徒

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金；服务费；犯；委任；委任状 vt. 委任；使服役；委托制作

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: guild
trans: n. 协会，行会；同业公会 n. (Guild)人名；(英)吉尔德

sentences.english: the Women’s Guild
sentences.chinese: 妇女协会

detailed_translations.english: an organization of people who do the same job or have the same interests

name: innovative
trans: adj. 革新的，创新的；新颖的；有创新精神的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: novelty
trans: n. 新奇；新奇的事物；新颖小巧而廉价的物品

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

name: Renaissance
trans: n. （艺术等的）新生，复活 n. (Renaissance) 文艺复兴，文艺复兴风格

name: draftsman
trans: n. [测] 绘图员；起草者；立案者

name: innovator
trans: n. 改革者，创新者

sentences.english: He is an innovator in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个领域的革新者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

name: mechanical
trans: adj. 机械的；力学的；呆板的；无意识的；手工操作的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；专利证；专利品 adj. 专利的；特许生产或销售的；显著的；公开的；（脉管等）开放的 v. 取得……的专利权；授予专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: technical
trans: adj. 工艺的，科技的；技术上的；专门的

sentences.english: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

sentences.english: I have no technical knowledge at all.
sentences.chinese: 我一点技术知识都没有。

sentences.english: technical training
sentences.chinese: 技术培训

detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: astronaut
trans: n. 宇航员，航天员；太空旅行者

sentences.english: So why become an astronaut at all?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

name: launch
trans: v. 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使……下水；开始；起飞 n. 发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: space station
trans: 空间站，太空站

detailed_translations.english: a large spacecraft that stays above the Earth and is a base for people travelling in space or for scientific tests

trans: v. 联合抵制；拒绝购买；拒绝参加 n. 联合抵制 n. (Boycott) 博伊科特（人名）

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: nonviolence
trans: n. 非暴力；非暴力事件

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境 n. (Element)人名；(德)埃勒门特；(英)埃利门特

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: Nobel Prize
trans: 诺贝尔奖

trans: n. 坚持不懈；不屈不挠 n. 耐性；毅力

sentences.english: He's a clever man,but fails in perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个聪明人，但缺乏毅力。

sentences.english: Their power does not come from rank or title but from intellect and perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的权力并非来自等级或头衔，而是来自他们的智慧和毅力。

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学；物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: Sorbonne
trans: n. （泛指）巴黎大学；索邦神学院

name: conclusion
trans: n. 结论；结局；推论

sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试 v. 尝试；试验；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

trans: n. 假设

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: observation
trans: n. 观察；监视；观察报告

sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

trans: adj. 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的 n. [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素

sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: canvas
trans: n. 帆布 vt. 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备 adj. 帆布制的

sentences.english: a canvas bag
sentences.chinese: 帆布包

detailed_translations.english: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

name: gallery

sentences.english: The bright modern painting stares out at you in the otherwise conservative gallery.
sentences.chinese: 有些古典派画廊也会陈列出明亮色彩的现代派绘画。

sentences.english: Statement and portrait together form a single image of a thinker. (See the interactive gallery, “Why Philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 陈述和肖像一起构成了一位思想家的独有影像。 （参见互动画廊，“何为哲学？”）

sentences.english: Whether you just want to browse our huge image gallery or want to share your personal photos with others, this is the site for you!
sentences.chinese: 无论你是想要浏览我们众多的画廊图片还是想要和其他人分享你的个人照片,这个网站绝对对你的味口。

detailed_translations.english: a small privately owned shop or studio where you can see and buy pieces of art

name: sculpture
trans: n. 雕塑；雕刻；刻蚀 vt. 雕塑；雕刻；刻蚀 vi. 从事雕刻

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

sentences.chinese: 描绘狩猎场面的彩色壁毯

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of heavy cloth on which coloured threads are woven to produce a picture, pattern etc

sentences.chinese: ...一条古罗马时代的高架渠。

detailed_translations.english: a structure like a bridge, that carries water across a river or valley

sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

sentences.chinese: 在一个浅的容器里倒一点胶水，用棉球沾点胶水然后粘到纸上——你就有了幅雪景壁饰！

sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

trans: n. 估计，计算

sentences.chinese: 改为十进制

sentences.chinese: 精确到小数点后三位的计算

sentences.chinese: 统计员用图表来表示统计结果。

sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

name: perpendicular
trans: adj. 垂直的，正交的；直立的；陡峭的 n. 垂线；垂直的位置

sentences.english: a perpendicular line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: a perpendicular wall of rock
sentences.chinese: 直立的石壁

detailed_translations.chinese: 垂直的，正交的；直立的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: not leaning to one side or the other but exactly vertical
an exactly vertical position or line

name: play

sentences.english: Kids were playing and chasing each other.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在互相追逐嬉闹。

sentences.chinese: 他在学习弹钢琴。

sentences.chinese: 图书馆的桌子上摆着一堆凌乱不整的书。

sentences.chinese: 头发凌乱得像吹乱的枯草，眼睛布满血丝，颓然地趿拉着拖鞋。

sentences.chinese: 在现实中，尽管盖茨的头发总是乱糟糟的，又长着张娃娃脸，不修边幅，他可是个老练的生意人，每走一步都成竹在胸。

name: ghastly

sentences.english: a ghastly accident
sentences.chinese: 可怕的事故

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；惨白的；惊人的；极坏的
detailed_translations.english: making you very frightened, upset, or shocked

name: sodden

sentences.chinese: 湿漉漉的衣服

sentences.chinese: 土地湿透了。

sentences.english: a nervous twitch
sentences.chinese: 神经性抽搐

if a part of someone’s body twitches, or if they twitch it, it makes a small sudden movement

name: capsize

sentences.chinese: 海的风浪变得很大，船翻了。

detailed_translations.english: if a boat capsizes, or if you capsize it, it turns over in the water

name: investigator

sentences.chinese: 警探

detailed_translations.english: someone who investigates things, especially crimes

name: maritime

sentences.english: San Francisco has lost nearly all of its maritime industry.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山几乎失去了所有海运业。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海的；海事的；沿海的；海员的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea or ships

name: salvage
trans: n. 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金 vt. 抢救；海上救助 n. (Salvage)人名；(法)萨尔瓦热

sentences.english: a massive salvage operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抢救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金
detailed_translations.english: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

name: shipwreck
trans: n. 海难；遇难船 vt. 使失事；使毁灭；使失败

sentences.english: survivors of the shipwreck
sentences.chinese: 此次海难的幸存者

sentences.english: narrowly escaping shipwreck
sentences.chinese: 险些遭遇船只失事

detailed_translations.english: the destruction of a ship in an accident

name: anticipate
trans: v. 预料，预期；预见，预计（并做准备）； 期盼，期望； 先于……做，早于……行动；在期限内履行（义务），偿还（债务）；提前使用

sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

trans: n. 指标，标志，迹象； 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计

sentences.english: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.
sentences.chinese: 所有主要的经济指标都表明贸易情况正在改善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计
detailed_translations.english: something that can be regarded as a sign of something else

name: sibling
trans: n. 兄弟姊妹；民族成员

sentences.english: Most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
sentences.chinese: 大多数年轻的吸烟者都是因为他们的朋友或者哥哥姐姐有吸烟习惯而受影响的。

detailed_translations.english: a brother or sister

name: trait
trans: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许 n. (Trait) （美、法）特雷（人名）

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: astronomy
trans: n. 天文学

sentences.english: The book treats of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲天文学的。

sentences.english: This was the birth of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这就是天文学的起源。

sentences.english: You could study astronomy , or space engineering , and be good at it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以学习天文学，或是空间工程学，可以学的很棒。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the stars and  planet s

name: astrophysicist
trans: n. 天体物理学家

name: classify
trans: vt. 分类；分等

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；（正式的）讨论 v. （尤指正式）讨论，辩论；仔细考虑

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: planetarium
trans: n. 天文馆；行星仪

sentences.english: The motions of the stars can be approximated in a planetarium.
sentences.chinese: 星星的运动可在天文馆里模拟。

sentences.english: Washington lived in an impoverished West Side community and has strong memories of preschool field trips to the library, zoo and planetarium where he learned to love science.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿住在贫困的西部社区，他深深地记得那时候在学前班时的图书馆，动物园和天文馆的活动，在那里，他学会了热爱科学。

sentences.english: Thecomplex also has Europe’s largest planetarium, an IMAX theater, and an opera house.
sentences.chinese: 其综合设施还有欧洲最大的天文馆，IMAX电影院和一个歌剧院。

detailed_translations.english: a building where lights on a curved ceiling show the movements of planets and stars

name: ban
trans: v. 禁止，取缔；（官方）把（某人）逐出某地 n. 禁止，禁令，禁忌；剥夺公民权的判决；诅咒；巴尼（罗马尼亚货币单位） n. (Ban) （美、罗马、克罗地亚）班恩（人名）

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: cause
trans: n. 原因；事业；目标 vt. 引起；使遭受

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: column
trans: n. 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图 adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: scrutiny
trans: n. 详细审查；监视；细看；选票复查

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍 vi. 忍耐；持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: masterpiece
trans: n. 杰作；绝无仅有的人

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

name: mortal
trans: adj. 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的 n. 人类，凡人 n. (Mortal)人名；(法、葡)莫塔尔

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: plead
trans: vt. 借口；为...辩护；托称 vi. 恳求；辩护

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: relinquish
trans: vt. 放弃；放手；让渡

sentences.english: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
sentences.chinese: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly

name: stow
trans: vt. 装载；收藏；使暂留；堆装 n. (Stow)人名；(英)斯托

sentences.english: Luke stowed his camera bags into the boot.
sentences.chinese: 卢克把他的相机袋收到旅行箱里。

detailed_translations.english: If you stow something somewhere, you carefully put it there until it is needed

name: crust
trans: n. 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮 vi. 结硬皮；结成外壳 vt. 盖以硬皮；在…上结硬皮

sentences.english: sandwiches with the crusts cut off
sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

detailed_translations.chinese: 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮
detailed_translations.english: the hard brown outer surface of bread

name: magma
trans: n. [地质] 岩浆；糊剂 n. (Magma)人名；(英)马格马

sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

name: mantle
trans: n. 地幔；斗篷；覆盖物 vi. 覆盖；脸红 vt. 覆盖 n. (Mantle)人名；(英、意)曼特尔

sentences.english: The parks and squares looked grim under a mantle of soot and ash.
sentences.chinese: 在一层烟尘的笼罩下，这些公园和广场显得阴沉沉的。

detailed_translations.english: a loose piece of outer clothing without sleeves, worn especially in former times
to cover the surface of something

name: plate
trans: n. 碟；金属板；金属牌；感光底片 vt. 电镀；给…装甲 n. (Plate)人名；(英、德、俄、西、意、瑞典)普拉特

sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

trans: n. 沟，沟渠；战壕；堑壕 vt. 掘沟 vi. 挖战壕；侵害 n. (Trench)人名；(英、西)特伦奇

sentences.chinese: 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。

sentences.chinese: 九点到十一点，他打算挖一个洞，或者一条小沟也行，没准儿还能从脏土里翻出什么好吃的呢。

sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

name: investor
trans: n. 投资者

sentences.english: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的主要投资方是法国国民信贷银行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money to a company, business, or bank in order to get a profit

trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩 vi. 劳动；努力；苦干 vt. 详细分析；使厌烦 n. (Labor)人名；(德、塞、法)拉博尔；(英)拉博

sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: ransom
trans: n. 赎金；赎回，释放 v. 为……交付赎金；赎回；勒索赎金；释放 n. (Ransom) （美、英、加）兰塞姆（人名）

sentences.english: The same system was used for ransoming or exchanging captives.
sentences.chinese: 同一系统也被用来赎回或交换俘虏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回，赎；勒索赎金；救赎；得赎金后释放

an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理；[会计] 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元 n. (Era)人名；(意、芬、印)埃拉

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的 vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地 n. (Habitat)人名；(德)哈比塔特

sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: prehistoric
trans: adj. 史前的；陈旧的

sentences.english: prehistoric burial grounds
sentences.chinese: 史前墓地

sentences.english: prehistoric animals
sentences.chinese: 史前动物

detailed_translations.english: relating to the time in history before anything was written down

name: Communist
trans: n. 共产党员；共产主义者 adj. 共产主义的

name: czar
trans: n. （帝俄的）沙皇，皇帝；独裁者

name: czarina
trans: n. 女沙皇；沙皇皇后

name: monarchy
trans: n. 君主政体；君主国；君主政治

sentences.english: the abolition of the monarchy
sentences.chinese: 君主制的废除

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主政体；君主国；君主政治
detailed_translations.english: the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen

name: parliament
trans: n. 议会，国会

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: inhabited
trans: adj. 有人居住的 v. 占据（inhabit的过去分词）；居住于

name: interpreter
trans: n. 解释者；口译者；注释器

sentences.english: Speaking through an interpreter (= using an interpreter ), Ahmed said, ‘I’m very worried about my wife and children.’
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德通过口译者说:“我很担心我的妻子和孩子们。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job

name: kidnap
trans: vt. 绑架；诱拐；拐骗

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

name: Shoshone
trans: n. 美国肖松尼族印第安人；肖松尼语 adj. 肖松尼人的；肖松尼语的（等于Shoshoni）

detailed_translations.chinese: 美国休休尼族印第安人;休休尼语
detailed_translations.english: a member of a North American Indian people of the southwestern US, related to the Aztecs

name: waterway
trans: n. 航道；水路；排水沟

sentences.english: There are more than 400 miles of waterways to explore in the area.
sentences.chinese: 此地有400多英里的航道有待勘察。

detailed_translations.english: a river or canal that boats travel on

name: colonist
trans: n. 殖民者；殖民地居民；移民 adj. 殖民主义者的；奉行殖民主义的

sentences.english: The colonists struggled through their first winter.
sentences.chinese: 这些殖民地居民艰难地度过了第一个冬天。

detailed_translations.english: someone who settles in a new colony

name: siege
trans: n. 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力 vt. 围攻；包围

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: treaty
trans: n. 条约，协议；谈判

sentences.english: Both sides have agreed to sign the treaty .
sentences.chinese: 双方都同意签署该条约。

sentences.english: The peace treaty ends nearly four years of violence.
sentences.chinese: 该和平条约结束了将近四年的暴力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 条约， 协议， 协定
detailed_translations.english: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

name: voyage
trans: n. 航行；航程；旅行记 vi. 航行；航海 vt. 飞过；渡过

sentences.english: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
sentences.chinese: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。

sentences.english: the Titanic’s maiden voyage
sentences.chinese: “泰坦尼克”号的首航

sentences.english: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我不想独自航行。

sentences.english: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
to travel to a place, especially by ship

name: buoyant
trans: adj. 轻快的；有浮力的；上涨的

sentences.english: a buoyant economy
sentences.chinese: 欣欣向荣的经济

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的；有浮力的；上涨的
detailed_translations.english: buoyant prices etc tend to rise

name: commerce
trans: n. 贸易；商业；商务

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: galleon
trans: n. 十五，十六世纪西班牙大型帆船

name: habitable
trans: adj. 可居住的；适于居住的

sentences.english: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for people to live in

name: hull
trans: n. 船体；（果实的）外壳 vt. [粮食] 去壳 n. (Hull)人名；(英)赫尔；(法)于尔

sentences.english: The hull had suffered extensive damage to the starboard side.
sentences.chinese: 船体右舷遭到大面积损坏。

detailed_translations.english: the main part of a ship that goes in the water

name: scurvy
trans: n. 坏血病 adj. 卑鄙的，下流的；不中用的

sentences.english: In humans, vitamin C deficiency causes scurvy, and can eventually cause death.

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: ramble
trans: v. （在乡间）漫步，闲逛；漫谈，闲聊；（植物）蔓生 n. （在乡间的）漫步，闲逛；（杂乱无章的）长篇大论

sentences.english: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得找个周末去乡下走走这个主意不错。

detailed_translations.english: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

name: survey
trans: n. 调查；测量；审视；纵览 vt. 调查；勘测；俯瞰 vi. 测量土地

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: vexation
trans: n. 苦恼；恼怒；令人烦恼的事

sentences.english: He kicked the broken machine in vexation.
sentences.chinese: 他懊恼得踢了这台坏机器一脚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 苦恼；恼怒；令人烦恼的事
detailed_translations.english: when you feel worried or annoyed by something

name: affectionate
trans: adj. 深情的； adj. 充满爱的；

sentences.english: an affectionate hug
sentences.chinese: 亲切的拥抱

detailed_translations.english: showing in a gentle way that you love someone and care about them

name: bustle
trans: v. 四下忙碌；使（人沿某方向）匆忙地走；繁忙 n. 喧闹；（旧时女子用的）裙撑

sentences.english: My mother bustled around the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里忙得团团转。

detailed_translations.english: to move around quickly, looking very busy

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹；活跃；裙撑；热闹的活动
detailed_translations.english: busy and usually noisy activity

name: dismal
trans: adj. 凄凉的，忧郁的；阴沉的，沉闷的；差劲的；可怜的

sentences.english: The future looks pretty dismal right now.
sentences.chinese: 目前前景似乎相当暗淡。

sentences.english: a dismal, grey afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一个阴沉灰暗的下午

detailed_translations.chinese: 凄凉的，忧郁的；阴沉的，沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: if a situation or a place is dismal, it is so bad that it makes you feel very unhappy and hopeless

name: soothing
trans: adj. 抚慰的；使人宽心的 v. 安慰；减轻痛苦（soothe的现在分词）

sentences.english: No one else leant over her, and whispered soothing words to her, or was near enough to hear the flutter of her beating heart.
sentences.chinese: 没有其他任何人向她弯下身去，低声地对她说些安慰的话，或跟她挨得很近，可以听到她颤动的心房正在怦怦地跳动。

sentences.english: He offered soothing words about the value of the French model in the recession and its ability to protect the most vulnerable from poverty.
sentences.chinese: 对于衰退中法兰西模式的价值，以及保护绝大多数易受伤害的贫困人口的能力，他给予了安慰。

name: astonishment
trans: n. 惊讶；令人惊讶的事物

sentences.english: She stared at him in astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 她吃惊地看着他。

detailed_translations.english: complete surprise

name: prick
trans: v. 戳；扎破；（使）感到刺痛；（眼泪）引起刺痛；（眼睛）发酸；（使）内心痛苦；驱使；（使）耳朵竖起 n. 扎；戳孔；沮丧；赶牛棒；笨蛋；穿刺；针刺感；（粗俚）阴茎；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: Prick the sausages before you grill them.
sentences.chinese: 烤之前把香肠戳孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in something using something sharp
a  penis

name: rush
trans: n. 冲进；匆促；急流；灯心草 adj. 急需的 vt. 使冲；突袭；匆忙地做；飞跃 vi. 冲；奔；闯；赶紧；涌现 n. (Rush)人名；(英)拉什

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: discontented
trans: adj. 不满的；不满意的 v. 不满意（discontent的过去式及过去分词）

name: ignorant
trans: adj. 无知的；愚昧的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: ingenuity
trans: n. 心灵手巧，独创性，足智多谋；精巧的装置

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.english: Sitting with my IV drip, I like to think about all the human labour and ingenuity that come together in this medical moment.
sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.english: And as the president said last week, no one should bet against the American worker, American business and American ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

name: portmanteau
trans: n. 旅行皮箱；混成词 adj. 多用途的，多性质的

name: unsatisfactory
trans: adj. 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的

sentences.english: an unsatisfactory situation
sentences.chinese: 让人不满意的状况

detailed_translations.chinese: 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的
detailed_translations.english: not good enough or not acceptable

name: bargain
trans: n. 交易；便宜货；契约 vt. （谈价钱后）卖 vi. 讨价还价；谈判

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: fabulous
trans: adj. 难以置信的；传说的，寓言中的；极好的

sentences.english: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
sentences.chinese: 那位公爵的巨额财富

sentences.english: You look fabulous!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.english: a fabulous meal
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

sentences.english: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

name: fretful
trans: adj. 焦躁的；烦燥的；起波纹的

sentences.english: Don't assume your baby automatically needs feeding if she's fretful.
sentences.chinese: 不要你的婴儿一焦躁就假定她必然需要喂食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 焦躁的；烦燥的；起波纹的
detailed_translations.english: If someone is fretful, they behave in a way that shows that they are worried or unhappy about something

name: refreshment
trans: n. 点心；起提神作用的东西；精力恢复

sentences.english: Refreshments will be served after the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 会后有茶点招待。

detailed_translations.chinese: 点心；起提神作用的东西；精力恢复
detailed_translations.english: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc

name: unicorn
trans: n. 独角兽；麒麟

sentences.english: The reason there are so few unicorn sightings today isn't because they are mythical creatures that never existed, but because of modern society's moral depravity.
sentences.chinese: 这些年很少有人见到独角兽，这并非因为那都是童话，现实里压根就不存在什么的。 而是现代社会人心不古，道德沦丧。

sentences.english: Many medieval pictures of the unicorn portray it resting its head, with phallic horn, in the lap of a maiden, an image with not too hidden sexual imagery.
sentences.chinese: 独角兽在许多中世纪的图画中，总是低着头，顶着阴茎一般的角，依偎在少女的裙下，呈现出一幅性暗示不那么隐晦的图景。

sentences.english: Opening image: A glorious well-oiled angel riding on a winged unicorn. Sure, it's sexy. But too sexy?
sentences.chinese: 开场图片：一个辉煌的醉酒天使骑在长翅膀的独角兽上。当然，它性感。但是很性感么？

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary animal like a white horse with a long straight horn growing on its head

name: uproar
trans: n. 骚动；喧嚣

sentences.english: The announcement caused uproar in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 公告在人群中引起了一阵骚动。

detailed_translations.english: a lot of noise or angry protest about something

name: armor
trans: n. 盔甲；装甲，防弹钢板；装甲部队，装甲车辆；（动物或植物的）保护外层；（感情、社交等的）防御 v. 为……装甲；为……提供（感情等的）防御 n. (Armor) （美、英、法）阿莫尔（人名）

sentences.english: The leading role in the film is costumed in medieval armor.
sentences.chinese: 影片中的主角穿着中古时代的甲胄。

sentences.english: This Courtly Poetry came out of the idea of chivalry and courtly love that you might associate with knights in shining armor.
sentences.chinese: 这首宫廷诗取材于骑士精神和典雅爱恋，你可能会想到这与身穿闪光的盔甲的骑士有关。

name: awkward
trans: adj. 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: ballad
trans: n. 歌谣，民谣；叙事歌谣；流行抒情歌曲

sentences.english: ...an eighteenth century ballad about some lost children called the Babes in the Wood.
sentences.chinese: …一首关于迷路儿童的名为《丛林中的宝贝》的18世纪民间叙事诗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歌谣，民谣；叙事歌谣；流行抒情歌曲
detailed_translations.english: a slow love song

name: bewilderment
trans: n. 困惑；迷乱；慌张

name: puzzle
trans: v. 迷惑，（使）困惑；（因迷惑）而苦思；使……为难 n. 谜，智力游戏；拼版玩具；不解之谜；谜一样的人或事物

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: dignified
trans: adj. 庄严的；有尊严的；高贵的 v. 使高贵（dignify的过去式）

sentences.english: a dignified old lady
sentences.chinese: 庄重的老太太

sentences.english: She made a dignified departure.
sentences.chinese: 她不失尊严地离去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 庄严的；有尊严的；高贵的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a calm and serious way, even in a difficult situation, which makes people respect you

name: perplexity
trans: n. 困惑；混乱

sentences.english: moral perplexities
sentences.chinese: 道德难题

detailed_translations.chinese: (正式用语)困惑，窘困，令人困惑的事或物
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being confused or worried by something you cannot understand

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: diplomat
trans: n. 外交家，外交官；有外交手腕的人；处事圆滑机敏的人

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: organization
trans: n. 组织；机构；体制；团体

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

name: confine
trans: n. （尤指某个地方限制行动自由的）边界；（尤指学科或活动领域的的）范围；限制 vt. 限制；禁闭；（因疾病、残疾）无法离开（床 、家、轮椅）；将 (自己或自己的活动) 局限于；（妇女）卧床分娩

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: entertain
trans: vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳 vi. 款待

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: protection
trans: n. 保护；防卫；护照

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: severe
trans: adj. 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: stampede
trans: n. 惊跑；人群的蜂拥；军队溃败 vi. 蜂拥；逃窜 vt. 使…惊逃；抢占

sentences.english: a herd of stampeding buffalo
sentences.chinese: 一群狂奔的水牛

detailed_translations.english: to be made frightened or worried so that you do something too quickly, without thinking enough about it

detailed_translations.chinese: 逃窜， 狂奔； 热潮， 风尚
detailed_translations.english: when a group of large animals or people suddenly start running in the same direction because they are frightened or excited

name: climate
trans: n. 气候；风气；思潮；风土

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: global warming
trans: 全球变暖

name: greenhouse gas
trans: n. 二氧化碳、甲烷等导致温室效应的气体

name: pollutant
trans: n. 污染物

sentences.english: a dumping ground for toxic pollutants
sentences.chinese: 有毒污染物堆放场

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty, and is caused by cars, factories etc

name: aristocracy
trans: n. 贵族；贵族统治；上层社会；贵族政治

sentences.english: dukes, earls, and other members of the aristocracy
sentences.chinese: 公爵、伯爵及其他贵族成员

sentences.english: the landed aristocracy
sentences.chinese: 拥有大量土地的贵族

detailed_translations.chinese: 贵族；贵族统治；上层社会；贵族政治
detailed_translations.english: the people in the highest social class, who traditionally have a lot of land, money, and power

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；方式；时髦人物 vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: ornate
trans: adj. 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的

sentences.english: an ornate gold mirror
sentences.chinese: 华丽的金镜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
detailed_translations.english: covered with a lot of decoration

name: toupee
trans: n. 假发；男子假发

name: wig
trans: n. 假发；要人；头脑 vt. 使戴假发；斥责 vi. 激动；发狂 n. (Wig)人名；(英、瑞典)威格；(德)维希

sentences.english: Jo wore a long wig that made her look very sexy.
sentences.chinese: 乔带着一头长长的假发，使她看起来很性感。

detailed_translations.english: artificial hair that you wear on your head

name: ambitious
trans: adj. 野心勃勃的；有雄心的；热望的；炫耀的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；忧愁；抑郁症；洼地；不景气；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: politics
trans: n. 政治，政治学；政治活动；政纲

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: undaunted
trans: adj. 勇敢的，无畏的

name: wit
trans: n. 智慧；才智；智力 n. (Wit)人名；(泰)威；(英、德、波)威特 v. 知道；即

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)
